description.narrative: Support to EuroMed Rights through the DAPP 2016 programme

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1.2. capacity-building - HRO/Ds have enhanced capacities to advocate, monitor, document and engage in actions relevant to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

target.value: Up to 100 representsatives of HRO/Ds receive training on issues pertaining to advocacy. monitoring/documentation. in relation to the thematic areas of the EMHRN

actual.value: 134 representatives of HROs were trained on issues identified as the most relevant to the particular thematic area by the Working Groups.

target.value: Up to 100 representsatives of HRO/Ds receive training on issues pertaining to advocacy. monitoring/documentation. in relation to the thematic areas of the EMHRN

actual.value: 134 representatives of HROs were trained on issues identified as the most relevant to the particular thematic area by the Working Groups.

title.narrative: 1.1. networking & dialogue - EMHRN members and other relevant CSOs participate in bi-annual working group meetings, define political priorities of EMHRN regional work, formulate joint strategies and implement joint initiatives on most pressing human rights issues in key thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds meet twice a year and network through participation in the EMHRN thematic working groups

actual.value: 249 representatives of HROs met in the EuroMed Rights thematic Working Groups and seminars. evaluated jointly the work over the last years. and defined political priorities for the future in relation to regional networking and dialogue on the shrinking space for civil sociey. gender equality and women's rights. migration and asylum. the Middle East conflict. and Economic and Social rights.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds meet twice a year and network through participation in the EMHRN thematic working groups

actual.value: 249 representatives of HROs met in the EuroMed Rights thematic Working Groups and seminars. evaluated jointly the work over the last years. and defined political priorities for the future in relation to regional networking and dialogue on the shrinking space for civil sociey. gender equality and women's rights. migration and asylum. the Middle East conflict. and Economic and Social rights.

title.narrative: 1.3. advocacy - HRO/Ds conduct joint as well as individual advocacy in relevant fora, including the UN, EU and EU member states as well as in South Mediterranean countries, making use of the joint documentation products to promote human rights values in national and regional reform processes.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in advocacy toward the EU/UN or national governments or bodies using regional HR instruments on/ in the framework of the EMHRN 5 thematics

actual.value: 41 HRDs participated in advocacy missions targetting the EU institutions. UN HRC and treaty bodies. EU member state governments. or national governments in relation to the shrinking space for civil society. combatting violence against women. respect for the rights of migrants and refugees. accountability in relation to the Middle East conflict. and Economic and Social rights.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in advocacy toward the EU/UN or national governments or bodies using regional HR instruments on/ in the framework of the EMHRN 5 thematics

actual.value: 41 HRDs participated in advocacy missions targetting the EU institutions. UN HRC and treaty bodies. EU member state governments. or national governments in relation to the shrinking space for civil society. combatting violence against women. respect for the rights of migrants and refugees. accountability in relation to the Middle East conflict. and Economic and Social rights.

title.narrative: 2.2. capacity-building - training sessions are targetting mainly the newly established organisations in the disadvantaged regions, identified through field visits.

target.value: At least 6 field visits per year. and at least 4 training sessions organised per year (15-20 participants each). targetting at least 40 representatives of newly established CSOs from all over the country.

actual.value: 7 field visits were conducted to the regions and 9 trainings were conducted reaching a total of 328 persons. on issues identified as the most relevant by working group members and other partners. In addition. many newly established NGOs built capacities from being involved in EuroMed Rights networking activities. as well as partners' and members activities.

target.value: At least 6 field visits per year. and at least 4 training sessions organised per year (15-20 participants each). targetting at least 40 representatives of newly established CSOs from all over the country.

actual.value: 7 field visits were conducted to the regions and 9 trainings were conducted reaching a total of 328 persons. on issues identified as the most relevant by working group members and other partners. In addition. many newly established NGOs built capacities from being involved in EuroMed Rights networking activities. as well as partners' and members activities.

title.narrative: 1.4. monitoring & documentation - HRO/Ds conduct joint monitoring and documentation and information sharing in relation to the 5 regional thematic areas covered by EMHRN.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in information sharing. joint monitoring and solidarity on/ in the framework of the EMHRN 5 thematics

actual.value: More than 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in information sharing. joint monitoring and solidarity in relation to the shrinking space for civil society. the effect of EU migration policies on the rights of migrants and refugees. on the legal. policy and protection frameworks for combatting violence against women. on mechanisms for accountability in the Middle East Conflict. and Economic and Social rights. A total of 78 briefings. statements. policy papers and reports have been produced and disseminated.

target.value: Up to 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in information sharing. joint monitoring and solidarity on/ in the framework of the EMHRN 5 thematics

actual.value: More than 100 representatives of HRO/Ds have engaged in information sharing. joint monitoring and solidarity in relation to the shrinking space for civil society. the effect of EU migration policies on the rights of migrants and refugees. on the legal. policy and protection frameworks for combatting violence against women. on mechanisms for accountability in the Middle East Conflict. and Economic and Social rights. A total of 78 briefings. statements. policy papers and reports have been produced and disseminated.

title.narrative:
Tunisian CSOs are able to network, share experiences, develop and conduct joint actions, including through flexible partnerships with EMHRN.
Result: 4437 Tunisian HRDs from different regions in Tunisia participated in joint events with EuroMed Rights within the fields of EU-Tunisia relations, justice reform, women's rights, eco-soc rights and migration. At least 50 events were done in partnership with or through support to EuroMed Rights partners. Through several field missions to the regions, new organisations were supported and included in networking activities. A meeting in January with key partners confirmed that the thematic priorities identified in 2015 were still the most relevant to continue in 2016 and they were throughout the year discussed at coordination meetings with partners and members. CSOs involved in partnerships with EuroMed Rights were further able to exchange experience, build capacity in relation to EU-Tunisia relations with regards to these themes.
2.3. advocacy - Tunisian CSOs are engaged in a regular dialogue with relevant officials and advocacy initiatives on EU-Tunisia relations.

target.value: At least 60 representatives from key Tunisian CSOs are engaged in regular coordination. and lead to 12 advocacy meetings in Tunisia and 3 advocacy missions to the EU.

actual.value: One international advocacy missions to Brussels as well as a total of 29 advocacy meetings and actions in Tunisia targeting Parlamentaries. Ministeries. the Presidency and 6 Embassies of EU Member countries were organized. More than 145 civil society representatives participated in the coordination and implementation of these events.

target.value: At least 60 representatives from key Tunisian CSOs are engaged in regular coordination. and lead to 12 advocacy meetings in Tunisia and 3 advocacy missions to the EU.

actual.value: One international advocacy missions to Brussels as well as a total of 29 advocacy meetings and actions in Tunisia targeting Parlamentaries. Ministeries. the Presidency and 6 Embassies of EU Member countries were organized. More than 145 civil society representatives participated in the coordination and implementation of these events.

title.narrative: 2.1. networking & dialogue - 3 to 4 priority areas and/or thematics of work identified in the beginning of each year through a consensus of the main civil society actors in Tunisia; Key CSOs from all over Tunisia are engaged in regular meetings with a view to mobilize the Tunisian civil society around the civil society forum;

target.value: A group of key players from the Tunisian NGO community - both historical and newly established - are engaged in regular activities addressing national political agendas while networking and sharing experience. amongst other in an annual civil society forum. which gathers a wider array of 200-300 associations from all over the country. At EMHRN level. priority policy themes and areas of action are defined by our members and partners.

actual.value: Throughout the year. EuroMed Rights facilitated a large number of networking meetings. events and conferences in accordance with the priority themes defined by key members and partners as most relevant to the political realities in Tunisia: eco-soc rights. including the rights of migrants: women's rights; and justice reform. Working Groups for each of these themes were active throughout the year. The civil society symposium orgsanised in December gathered 110 national and international organisations. A total of 4437 people particpated in these networking events.

target.value: A group of key players from the Tunisian NGO community - both historical and newly established - are engaged in regular activities addressing national political agendas while networking and sharing experience. amongst other in an annual civil society forum. which gathers a wider array of 200-300 associations from all over the country. At EMHRN level. priority policy themes and areas of action are defined by our members and partners.

Working Groups for each of these themes were active throughout the year. The civil society symposium orgsanised in December gathered 110 national and international organisations. A total of 4437 people particpated in these networking events.

title.narrative:
SO1.1. Key outcome indicator 1: Regional. European and South Mediterranean human rights organisations and activists are able to meet, network, strategize together and conduct joint actions, including monitoring, documentation, solidarity and advocacy on human rights standards and violations.
Result: Of the total 524* representatives of HROs/HRDs who participated in EuroMed Rights' Working Group meetings, seminars, trainings, advocacy actions, and monitoring and documentation work in relation to regional networking and dialogue on the shrinking space for civil sociey, gender equality and women's rights, migration and asylum, the Middle East conflict, and Economic and Social rights, at least 75 % of those who responded to an evaluation (survey or oral evaluation) stated that they were satisfied or very satisfied with the benefits they gained from their participation.
